notes: On 16 Mar, suspected militants shot dead a female off-duty SPO at her house in Vehil village (Shopian, J&K).

On March 15, a Kashmiri shawl trader was beaten up and robbed by an unidentified men at Park Circus in Kolkata city (Kolkata, West Bengal). He claimed the youth attacked him with a knife after he showed him his identity.

assoc_actor_2: YSRCP: Yuvajana, Sramika, Rythu Congress Party; Former Government of India (2014-)
notes: Between 14-15 Mar, in Pulivendula town (Kadapa, AP), a YSRCP member and former State Minister was found dead in his residence. Preliminary investigations by police treat the case as murder by unidentified assailants. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: JKNC: Jammu and Kashmir National Conference
notes: On 14 Mar, suspected militants shot and injured a JKNC activist at Thaji War village in Bijbehara tehsil (Anantnag, J&K).
On 14 Mar, suspected militants abducted a civilian from his home in Dogripora village (Awantipora, J&K). He was taken to nearby Gulzarpora village, where he was shot and killed.
On 13 Mar, a former soldier was killed by suspected militants outside his home in Pinglena village (Pulwama, J&K). The man had deserted from the military in September 2018.

actor1: NSCN-IM: National Socialist Council of Nagaland-Isak-Muivah
notes: On March 12, a woman was abducted by NSCN IM cadres from New Wangparel Village (Chandel, Manipur). She was rescued by security forces on March 13.
On 12 Mar, near Sriperumbudur (Kanchipuram, TN), a man and his companions hacked to death a relative at Kundumedu village near the area over the latter's affair with the man's wife.

Between 5 March and 11 March, the husband of a Congress councillor was threatened and assaulted by the Nabha municipal council president in Nabha city (Patiala, Punjab). This after he raised questions about a promised construction project on social media. [size=no report]
On 11 March, a group of Naxals killed a youth and torched several vehicles engaged in the road construction work at Kukurakunda village under the Mathili police station (Malkangiri district, Odisha).

On 11 March, a man who was a witness to the murder of his two brothers during the 2013 Muzaffarnagar riots, was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Muzaffarnagar town (UP) two weeks before he was to appear for the next hearing in the ongoing trial. Suspected incidence of communal violence. [size=no report]

On 10 March, an off-duty police sub-inspector and a school teacher were abducted by suspected Communist Party of India-Maoist (CPI-Maoist) cadres from Rewali village under Aranpur police station limits (Dantewada, Chhattisgarh).

On March 9, a Trinamul supporter was shot at and injured in the abdomen by three suspected TMC members in Durgapur city (Paschim Bardhaman, West Bengal). Sources claimed the reason behind the attack is a turf war in the area, between two groups of the political party.

assoc_actor_2: YSRCP: Yuvajana, Sramika, Rythu Congress Party; Government of India (2014-); Prisoners (India)
notes: On 9 Mar, in Nellore area (Sri Potti Sraramulu Nellore, AP), a YSRCP rural legislator was allegedly injured while in police custody during his arrest over his verbal attack on a police officer during a protest the previous day regarding deletion of votes.

On 9 Mar, in Cuddalore (Cuddalore, TN), at least 6 members of an intermediate caste allegedly assaulted and killed a 17-year old member of the SC/ST from Adi-Dravidar Colony. The NGO claimed that the reason for the attack was because the assailants disapprove that their village was surrounded by Adi Dravidar hamlets.

actor1: NSCN-IM: National Socialist Council of Nagaland-Isak-Muivah
notes: On March 8, five armed cadres of the NSCN-IM attacked a Kuki family in Chassad village (Kamjong, Manipur). They kicked and assaulted the father, severely injuring him.
On 8 Mar, in Adoni tehsil (Kurnool, AP), an Additional District Public Relations Officer (DPRO) was stoned to death by unidentified assailants for unknown reasons.
On 8 Mar, a youth was hospitalised after being assaulted by soldiers at an army camp in Mast Pora (Shopian, J&K).
On 8 Mar, suspected militants attempted to abduct an off-duty soldier from his home at Qazipora village in Chadoora tehsil (Budgam, J&K). The soldier managed to escape.

On 7 March, a group of 15-20 armed men attacked a family in Balraj Nagar locality in Bathinda city (Punjab) an attempt to grab their residential property. Four persons were injured and treated by doctors.

assoc_actor_2: INSO: India National Students' Organisation; Students (India)
notes: On 6 March, a man was shot dead and three others injured in Sector 49 in Chandigarh city (Chandigarh) by unidentified persons. The attack is believed to be connected to a rivalry over control of the Indian National Student Organisation at DAV College.
On 6 March, a former army officer was shot dead in Jewar town (Gautam Buddha Nagar, Uttar Pradesh) by two unidentified persons. The attack is believed to be connected to a property dispute.

On 6 March, the husband of a councillor was shot and wounded in the Loni area (Ghaziabad; Uttar Pradesh) by two persons from the area. The attack is believed to be connected to a property dispute with his neighbours.
On 6 March, a BJP leader was shot and wounded in the Dehat Kotwali area in Bahraich city (Uttar Pradesh) when unidentified persons fired on his convoy.

actor1: NSCN-R: National Socialist Council of Nagaland-Reformation
notes: On March 6, National Socialist Council of Nagaland-Reformation (NSCN-R) militants abducted three workers of a road construction firm from a place between Kangpokpi city and Changoubung (Kangpokpi, Manipur). They were later released on March 10.
On March 6, a youth suffered bullet injuries when suspected BJP supporters fired at Trinamul supporters at Rabindra Bhavan in Malda city (Malda, West Bengal).
Around 6 Mar, soldiers allegedly snatched ID cards and mobile phones from three youths and summoned them to an army camp in Mast Pora (Shopian, J&K), where they were assaulted.

On March 5, a local Trinamul leader was shot dead near his home in Rudrabati village in Kandi area (Murshidabad, West Bengal). The victim was an accused in a 2015 murder case and was currently out on bail. The accused attackers are relatives of the person who had been allegedly killed by the victim in 2015.

assoc_actor_2: DYFI: Democratic Youth Federation of India; CPI(M): Communist Party of India (Marxist)
notes: On 4 Mar, in a coastal area of Tanur (Malappuram, Kerala), a former secretary and workers of DYFI's area committee (CPM) were seriously injured in an attack by unidentified assailants. The incident is believed to be a continuation of political clash between the CPM and the IUML workers in the region.

On 3 Mar, in Quepem tehsil area (South Goa, Goa), residents from Curchorem attacked residents of Tilamol or Xeldem with knives and hockey sticks for unknown reasons, injuring a few residents. This occurred during a series of rioting events committed by Curchorem residents on that day. No further information was provided.

On March 3, supporters of a NPP candidate who lost the election attacked families alleged to have supported the winning UDP candidate, in Mowkaiaw village (West Jaintia Hills, Meghalaya). The victims were attacked with stones and lethal weapons. Vehicles were also damaged in the attacked.
Assumed on 2 Mar, in Coimbatore district (TN), an intersex activist and trans person was assaulted by an unidentified person. No further information was provided.

On March 1, a Dalit youth was assaulted with an iron rod by a temple priest shouting casteist remarks in Gosainganj (Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh) after he took water from a utensil outside the temple. The youth was critically injured.

On 1 Mar, in Hassan taluk (Hassan, Karnataka), a Congress party worker and husband of a panchayat member hit, scolded, and threatened a secretary of Seege Gram Panchayat at the GP office over an argument regarding issuing of khatas of some properties.
